| 2.1 Baler incorporates physical barriers to prevent foreign body contamination | • Risk assessment for metal, plastic, glass contamination<br>• Protective guarding specifications<br>• Integrated kicker mechanism safety assessment | [ ] Pass [ ] Fail<br>Comment: | HACCP Coordinator |
| 2.2 Hydraulic system uses food-grade lubricants where leakage risk exists | • Lubricant NSF H1 certification<br>• Hydraulic system leak containment measures<br>• Maintenance lubrication schedule | [ ] Pass [ ] Fail<br>Comment: | Maintenance Manager |
| 2.3 Equipment placement prevents cross-contamination between waste and production areas | • Site layout drawing showing baler location<br>• Airflow assessment<br>• Physical barrier/segregation confirmation | [ ] Pass [ ] Fail<br>Comment: | Site Manager |

| 3.1 Documented cleaning procedure specific to V5 baler model | • Validated cleaning SOP<br>• Chemical compatibility list<br>• Cleaning frequency matrix | [ ] Pass [ ] Fail<br>Comment: | Hygiene Manager |
| 3.2 Drainage provisions prevent pooling of cleaning water | • Floor gradient assessment at installation point<br>• Drainage capacity calculation<br>• Baler base frame elevation verification | [ ] Pass [ ] Fail<br>Comment: | Engineering Manager |
| **4. OPERATIONAL CONTROLS** |  |  |  |
| 4.1 Safety interlocks prevent operation during cleaning/maintenance | • PLC controller safety logic documentation<br>• Lock-out/tag-out compatibility<br>• Emergency stop functionality test | [ ] Pass [ ] Fail<br>Comment: | H&S Manager |
| 4.2 Noise level (70 dB) compliant with food production area limits | • Acoustic assessment report<br>• PPE requirements defined<br>• Noise containment measures if needed | [ ] Pass [ ] Fail<br>Comment: | H&S Manager |
| **5. WASTE HANDLING SPECIFICATIONS** |  |  |  |
| 5.1 Bale dimensions (750mm W) allow movement through facility without entering production areas | • Waste flow diagram<br>• Door width verification (all waste route doors)<br>• Bale trolley compatibility confirmation | [ ] Pass [ ] Fail<br>Comment: | Operations Manager |
| 5.2 Compaction force (5 tonnes) adequate for expected food waste types | • Waste stream analysis<br>• Trial baling results for typical waste<br>• Bale density targets achieved (50-100kg range) | [ ] Pass [ ] Fail<br>Comment: | Waste Coordinator |
| **6. COMMISSIONING & VALIDATION** |  |  |  |
| 6.1 Factory Acceptance Testing (FAT) completed at supplier facility | • FAT protocol and results<br>• Performance verification against specification<br>• Witnessed testing documentation | [ ] Pass [ ] Fail<br>Comment: | QA Manager |

| 6.3 Operational Qualification (OQ) demonstrates consistent performance | • OQ protocol with acceptance criteria<br>• 28-second cycle time verification<br>• Automatic/manual cycle testing | [ ] Pass [ ] Fail<br>Comment: | Validation Lead |
